summary:
Evelien van den Broek is a composer, performer and producer of electronic music, based in Amsterdam. She writes for film, dance, live performance, sound walks, theatre and visual art. Her latest projects are Biophonica, with music about mass extinction, and Aventurijn, an online one-week music cure for good luck.

www.evelienvandenbroek.com | www.evelienvandenbroek.bandcamp.com

profile_positions.description:
Music and sounddesign for multimedia (film, theatre, dance, soundwalks (Soundtrackcity), stage performance, soundinstallations). Singer, performing with live electronics.

Please visit http://www.evelienvandenbroek.com for a complete overview.
profile_positions.title: Composer

profile_positions.description:
False Memories - I clearly recall being able to breathe under water as a child.

False Memories consists of songs on the cutting edge of experimental pop, electronics and modern classical. Somewhere between the experimental pop of Björk and My Brightest Diamond and the folk fantasies of Kurt Weill. Van den Broek was inspired by the colourful collection of texts from The False Memory Archive of the British artist A.R. Hopwood. An archive consisting of anonymously submitted memories of events that never occurred. “I clearly recall being able to breathe under water as a child” isn’t even the strangest memory from the rich collection. “I remember running out of the hospital as a newborn baby,” and “I remember very vividly, as a child, swiping my finger on a matchbox and my finger setting fire”. A concerttour built around a doubt, humor, recognition and moments of touching beauty, with exciting interactive video projections by Marcel Wierckx. With composition, voice and live electronics by Evelien van den Broek, with Tony Roe on synths, Koen Kaptijn on trombone & electonics and Richard van Kruysdijk percussion & electronic beats.
profile_positions.title: False Memories

profile_positions.description:
Concept, music, production, voice, synths, recordings for Aventurijn, an online one-week music cure for good luck. With visual art by Mees Joachim van Amesfoort. Go to: www.aventurijn.online

After following this cure, you will be lucky and misfortune will be averted. Are you desperately looking for a dream home or a new love? Are you short of cash or do you need another job? Is everything in general a bit disappointing? Aventurijn will help you. Ingredients: every day, for the duration of one week, you’ll receive an encouraging visual artwork, an essential ritual, and a brand new song of the day. Start on day 1 and follow the directions carefully for a week, up to and including day 7. Only then will the music cure really work.

concept, composition, synths, vocals, production, recordings evelien van den broek (leafsheep) | mixing sandor caron | mastering uwe teichert at studio elektropolis | visual art mees joachim van amesfoort | photo richard ayres | website kanjijvoormij |  socials & online communication: enprofil culture | supported by performing arts fund nl, #investeringsfondsmuziek, @bumastemra and @minocw.
profile_positions.title: Aventurijn

profile_positions.description:
In Biophonica, Evelien gives her sonic response to mass extinction caused by mankind. Animals die en masse and we are so alienated from nature that we hardly seem to notice it. With nature recordings, disturbing trumpet sounds, crushing electronic beats and two chirping, squeaking and growling analog synths, Evelien has made raw, mesmerising and mournful music. Music that navigates between electronic- and pop music, sound art and contemporary classical. It premiered at the November Music festival on November 9th 2019. In 2020 the album Endlings was released, with music from Biophonica.

composition, electronics, texts, production evelien van den broek | trumpet, electronics mark nieuwenhuis | visuals timo hoogland | bird design sound modules edo paulus | live sound engineer sandor caron | studio production and -mix gijs van klooster | graphic design richard van kruysdijk | mary river turtle photo chris van wyk

Biophonica is financially supported by the Performing Arts Fund NL.
profile_positions.title: Biophonica | Endlings

profile_positions.description:
Dutch trio Daisy Bell’s music varies from atmospheric soundscapes to experimental, minimal electro pop. With a collection of acoustic and electronic instruments, live sampling, live sound manipulation and harmony vocals, Daisy Bell switches from soft and intimate to a raw and vibrant wall of sound.
On stage, the band is lit up by large projections of poems by William Blake (1757-1827), which they use as their lyrics.

Daisy Bell debuted with a concert for VPRO radio (NL), broadcast live via satellite in 25 countries. Shortly after that they released their first songs on pink vinyl on WORM Records, were the support act for CocoRosie and played several gigs including Faust's prestigious Avantgarde Festival (Germany). In 2014 they toured with gamelan ensemble Gending with their programme Year Without A Summer.

In December 2013, they recorded their debut album with engineer Sandor Caron (Knalpot) at the legendary Hilvaria Studios in the south of the Netherlands.
It was then mixed and produced by Darren Allison (producer of Efterklang, Amatorski, Belle & Sebastian, Spiritualized a.m.m.) in London and will be released november 2015 by Opa Loka Records (GER). www.daisybell.eu
profile_positions.title: Singer/Songwriter

profile_positions.description:
In the new song cycle “crush. crash.” by KUrKKU (Evelien van den Broek) all the sound material is created with a single female voice and live electronics and send to five speakers. With Wii game controllers, laptop and foot pedal Evelien deforms and cuts up her voice. Tornadoes, industrial machinery and insects seem to surround you, when suddenly you’ll find yourself in the middle of a dreamy choir. Loopers, bouncing delays, heavenly reverb, distortion and live sampling-scratching are some of the sound manipulations that are used. Songs about absurd, awkward and obsessive love. About relationships that get totally out of hand. With poems by E. E. Cummings and Toon Tellegen, and a letter from an erotomaniac. Unruly and compelling music on the cutting edge of electronic pop, soundscape, noise and classical. www.kurkku.nl

Concept, composition, performance, live electronics, production: Evelien van den Broek. Cable coverings: Tanya Eymann. For this project Van den Broek received a composition grant from the Performing Arts Fund NL. Thanks to: Jennifer, Paul and Edo.
profile_positions.title: Singer, composer, live electronics

company.name: The Obscure Thoughts of Isabella Green

profile_positions.company: The Obscure Thoughts of Isabella Green
profile_positions.description: Zangeres/performer in een multimedia-voorstelling van Dyane Donck voor gamelan (ensemble Gending), live-elektronica (Richard van Kruysdijk) en stem. In een decor met oogstrelend verontrustende film- en graphic novel-projecties speelt Evelien van den Broek de rol van Isabella Green. De muziek verwijst naar Alva Noto, David Lynch en Steve Reich, en slingert van meditatief naar opzwepend, van duister naar hemels. De filmbeelden zijn van Auke Hamers en de illustraties van Rik Wielheesen.
profile_positions.title: Singer/performer
Coach for Media & Performance Minor students

profile_positions.description: Production work for a multi media performance by Dyane Donck, with several concerts in the Netherlands. Singer/performer in on stage video projection.
profile_positions.title: Producer & video singer/performer
